article.title: Science Applications International Corporation and Lockheed Martin to Support U.S. Air Force
article.author: Katie Packard
article.text: Science Applications International Corporation and Lockheed Martin have been selected by the U.S. Air Force Warner Robins Air Logistics Center, Warner Robins Air Force Base, Georgia, to support the future flexible acquisition and sustainment tool (F2AST) program. The contract has a three-year base period of performance with two two-year options with a total value of $6.9 billion. F2AST will support Air Force weapons systems, and the contract includes work on special operations forces C-130s and B-52 sustainment and avionics systems. It also combines existing flexible acquisition and sustainment tool (FAST) and integrated weapons system support program (IWSSP) requirements.
